intro: Wyethia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is named after the botanist John Bolander, who first described it. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
